response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (20 years old)", "high", "Young age is associated with higher impulsivity and likelihood of reoffending."],
    ["Gender (male)", "high", "Male gender statistically correlates with higher recidivism rates."],
    ["Race (White)", "low", "Race is not a significant predictor in itself without other contextual factors."],
    ["Arrest History (1 arrest, no conviction)", "medium", "A previous arrest shows some risk, though the lack of conviction mitigates it somewhat."],
    ["Physical Attributes (6'1\", 155 lbs)", "low", "Body metrics are not typically related to recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital Status and Living Situation (never married, living alone)", "medium", "Living alone and being unmarried can indicate less social support, slightly increasing risk."],
    ["Education (High school diploma, enrolled in college)", "low", "Pursuit of higher education is a protective factor against recidivism."],
    ["Employment History (5 jobs in a year)", "medium", "Frequent job changes may signal instability, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Substance Use (Marijuana in past 4 years)", "medium", "Recent drug use is a moderate risk factor for recidivism."],
    ["Mental Health (No recent depression)", "low", "Absence of depression is a protective factor in risk assessments."],
    ["Household Size in Youth (lived in household of size 4)", "low", "A typical household size implies a neutral background factor."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with higher impulsivity and likelihood of reoffending.
Male gender statistically correlates with higher recidivism rates.
Race is not a significant predictor in itself without other contextual factors.
A previous arrest shows some risk, though the lack of conviction mitigates it somewhat.
Body metrics are not typically related to recidivism risk.
Marital Status and Living Situation (never married, living alone)
Living alone and being unmarried can indicate less social support, slightly increasing risk.
Education (High school diploma, enrolled in college)
Pursuit of higher education is a protective factor against recidivism.
Employment History (5 jobs in a year)
Frequent job changes may signal instability, contributing moderately to risk.
Recent drug use is a moderate risk factor for recidivism.
Absence of depression is a protective factor in risk assessments.
Household Size in Youth (lived in household of size 4)
A typical household size implies a neutral background factor.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 20-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 1 inch and weighs 155 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 4-year college. He has held 5 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived in a household of size 4.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
